caption: sc:token
docHTML:
localStorage.getItem('jwt_token');
Retrieves the JSON Web Token (JWT) from the browser's local storage.

This is a standard method for accessing a stored authentication token needed to make authenticated API calls.

caption: sc:headers
docHTML:
{headers:{"Content-Type":"application/json","X-Authorization":"Bearer "+localStorage.getItem("jwt_token")}}
Generates the standard HTTP headers object required for making authenticated API requests to a Thingsboard server.This snippet first retrieves the JWT from localStorage and then constructs the headers object.

caption: sc:http.get
docHTML:
self.ctx.http.get(`url`, {headers})
This snippet sends an HTTP GET request with a JWT token retrieved from localStorage for authorization. The response is handled asynchronously using the subscribe method.

caption: sc:http.post
docHTML:
self.ctx.http.post(`url`, payload={}, {headers})
This snippet sends an HTTP POST request with a payload and a JWT token in the Authorization header. Like the GET request, the response is handled asynchronously using the subscribe method.

caption: sc:tablePagination
docHTML:
syncross.tablePagination(defaultPageSize=20, defaultPageOptions=[20, 50, 100])
Creates a pagination controller with utility methods to manage paging state.

@param {number} [defaultPageSize=20] - Default number of items per page.
@param {number[]} [defaultPageOptions=[20, 50, 100]] - Available page size options.
@returns {object} Pagination controller with methods to manage page state.

caption: sc:getStateList
docHTML:
syncross.getStateList()
Returns a list of state types used in the application.

@returns {string[]} An array of state names.

caption: sc:getTimeMacroList
docHTML:
syncross.getTimeMacroList()
Returns a list of predefined time macros commonly used in filters and reports.

@returns {string[]} An array of time macro labels such as "Today", "Last 7 Days", etc.

caption: sc:timeFormatMap
docHTML:
syncross.timeFormatMap(type='Today')
Returns a time format string based on the given macro type.

@param {string} [type='Today'] - The time macro type.
@returns {string} The corresponding time format string.

caption: sc:getTimeData
docHTML:
syncross.getTimeData(type='Today', weekStartDay='Sunday', dayStartTime='00:00', prev=false)
Generates time range data based on a time macro type.

@param {string} type - A valid time macro type (e.g., from `getTimeMacroList()`).
@param {string} weekStartDay - The day the week starts on (e.g., "Sunday", "Monday").
@param {string} dayStartTime - The starting time of the day in "HH:mm" format.
@param {boolean} prev - Whether to generate the previous period's time range.
@returns {object} An object containing the computed start date, end date, and aggregation type.

caption: sc:getSyncedChartOptions
docHTML:
syncross.getSyncedChartOptions(chartOption, theme='light')
Applies theme-based styling to a given chart option configuration object.

@param {object} chartOption - The chart configuration object (e.g., ECharts option).
@param {string} [theme='light'] - The theme to apply ("light" or "dark").
@returns {object} The updated chart option object with synchronized theme styles.

caption: sc:getTheme
docHTML:
syncross.getTheme()
Retrieves the current UI theme from the document element.

@returns {string} 'dark' or 'light'.

caption: sc:getTimeFilter
docHTML:
syncross.getTimeFilter()
Retrieves the stored time filter configuration from localStorage.

@returns {object} An object containing the selected time range type and associated date information.

caption: sc:getBarChartOption
docHTML:
syncross.getBarChartOption(title, subtitle, xAxisData, yAxisName, series, theme='light', tooltipUnit='tCO2e')
Generates the configuration object for a themed bar chart.

@param {string} [title='title'] - The main title of the chart.
@param {string} [subtitle='subtitle'] - The subtitle of the chart.
@param {Array} xAxisData - The data array for the x-axis categories.
@param {string} yAxisName - The label for the y-axis.
@param {Array} series - The series data array for the chart.
@param {string} [theme='light'] - The theme for the chart.
@param {string} [tooltipUnit='tCO2e'] - The unit for the tooltip.
@returns {object} The ECharts bar chart configuration object.

caption: sc:getLineChartOption
docHTML:
syncross.getLineChartOption(title, subtitle, xAxisData, yAxisName, series, theme='light')
Generates the configuration object for a themed line chart.

@param {string} [title='title'] - The main title of the chart.
@param {string} [subtitle='subtitle'] - The subtitle of the chart.
@param {Array} xAxisData - The data array for the x-axis categories.
@param {string} yAxisName - The label for the y-axis.
@param {Array} series - The series data array for the chart.
@param {string} [theme='light'] - The theme for the chart.
@returns {object} The ECharts line chart configuration object.

caption: sc:getDoughnutOption
docHTML:
syncross.getDoughnutOption(color, theme)
Generates the configuration object for a themed doughnut gauge chart.

@param {string} color - The color used for the progress indicator.
@param {string} theme - The theme of the chart, either 'light' or 'dark'.
@returns {object} The ECharts doughnut gauge chart configuration object.

caption: sc:getPiechartOption
docHTML:
syncross.getPiechartOption(title='', seriesName='', data=[], theme='light')
Generates an ECharts pie chart option configuration.

@param {string} [title=''] - The title of the pie chart.
@param {string} [seriesName=''] - The name for the data series.
@param {Array

caption: sc:getChartSubtitle
docHTML:
syncross.getChartSubtitle(type='Today', mode='Consumption')
Generates a formatted subtitle string for charts based on the selected time type and mode.

@param {string} [type='Today'] - The selected time range type.
@param {string} [mode='Consumption'] - The mode or metric type.
@returns {string} A formatted subtitle describing the time range and mode.

caption: sc:getDataFromSource
docHTML:
syncross.getDataFromSource(data, param={}, dataOnly=false)
Filters and retrieves data from a given data source based on optional parameters.

@param {Array} data - The array of data objects to filter (e.g., `self.ctx.data`).
@param {Object} [param={}] - Optional filtering parameters.
@param {boolean} [dataOnly=false] - If true, returns only the `.data` property of the first matched item.
@returns {Array|Object|string} Filtered data array, single data object, or error message.

caption: sc:customDialog
snippet:
template=`
Title
some text
`; self.ctx.customDialog.customDialog(template, InfoDialogController, {data: data, index: index, type: \$scope.currentSelectedItem}).subscribe(resp=>{}); function InfoDialogController(instance) { instance.close=function(){ instance.dialogRef.close(null); } }
docHTML:
self.ctx.customDialog(template, InfoDialogController, {data: data})
Opens a custom dialog with the provided template and controller, passing data, index, and optional type. The dialog can handle form submissions and close events, with responses managed through an observable. Returns: An observable for response handling.

caption: mat:auto-complete
snippet:
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" floatLabel="never" subscriptSizing="dynamic"> 
<!--subscriptSizing: 'fixed' | 'dynamic'; appearance: 'fill'|'outline' -->
    <mat-label>Label</mat-label>
    <input type="text" placeholder="Pick one" matInput [matAutocomplete]="auto" (input)="handleInput(\$event)">
    <mat-autocomplete autoActiveFirstOption #auto="matAutocomplete">
      @for (option of options; track option) {<mat-option [value]="option">{{option}}</mat-option>}
    </mat-autocomplete>
</mat-form-field>

caption: mat:chip-input
snippet:
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" subscriptSizing="dynamic">
    <!--subscriptSizing: 'fixed' | 'dynamic'; appearance: 'fill'|'outline' -->
    <mat-label>Label</mat-label>
    <mat-chip-grid #chipGrid>
        @for (fruit of fruits; track fruit) {
            <mat-chip-row (removed)="remove(fruit)">
                {{fruit}}
                <button matChipRemove [attr.aria-label]="'remove ' + fruit"><mat-icon>cancel</mat-icon></button>
            </mat-chip-row>
        }
    </mat-chip-grid>
    <input placeholder="New Fruit..." #fruitInput [matChipInputFor]="chipGrid" (input)="handleInput(\$event)" [matAutocomplete]="auto" />
    <mat-autocomplete #auto="matAutocomplete" (optionSelected)="selected(\$event)">
        @for (fruit of options; track fruit) {<mat-option [value]="fruit">{{fruit}}</mat-option>}
    </mat-autocomplete>
</mat-form-field>

<script type="text/javascript" charset="utf-8">
const \$scope=self.ctx.\$scope;
\$scope.options= ['One', 'Two', 'Three'];
\$scope.fruits=[]
\$scope.selected=function(\$event){
    \$scope.fruits.push(\$event.option.viewValue)
}
\$scope.remove=function(item){
    indx=\$scope.fruits.indexOf(item);
    \$scope.fruits.splice(indx,1)
}
\$scope.handleInput=function(\$event){
    if (\$event.data!=',') {
    }else{
        \$scope.fruits.push(\$event.target.value)
        \$event.target.value='';
    }
}
</script>

caption: mat:date-picker
snippet:
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" subscriptSizing="dynamic">
    <!--subscriptSizing: 'fixed' | 'dynamic'; appearance: 'fill'|'outline' -->
  <mat-label>Choose a date</mat-label>
  <input matInput [matDatepicker]="picker" (dateChange)="handleDateChange(\$event)" (click)="picker.open()">
  <mat-datepicker-toggle matIconSuffix [for]="picker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
  <mat-datepicker #picker></mat-datepicker>
</mat-form-field>
<!--Move the javascript code to javascript block
\$scope.handleDateChange=function(\$event){
    console.log(\$event.value)
}
-->

caption: mat:date-range-picker
snippet:
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" subscriptSizing="dynamic">
    <!--subscriptSizing: 'fixed' | 'dynamic'; appearance: 'fill'|'outline' -->
  <mat-label>Enter a date range</mat-label>
  <mat-date-range-input [rangePicker]="rangePicker">
    <input matStartDate placeholder="Start date" (dateChange)="handleDateChange(\$event, 'start')" (click)="rangePicker.open()">
    <input matEndDate placeholder="End date" (dateChange)="handleDateChange(\$event, 'end')">
  </mat-date-range-input>
  <mat-datepicker-toggle matIconSuffix [for]="rangePicker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
  <mat-date-range-picker #rangePicker></mat-date-range-picker>
</mat-form-field>

<!--Javascript code.
Move Javascript code to javascript block.
\$scope.handleDateChange=function(\$event, pos){
    console.log(\$event.value, pos)
}
-->

caption: mat:month-picker
snippet:
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" subscriptSizing="fixed">
    <!--subscriptSizing: 'fixed' | 'dynamic'; appearance: 'fill'|'outline' -->
    <mat-label>Select Month</mat-label>
    <input matInput [matDatepicker]="monthPicker" id="monthPicker" (click)="monthPicker.open()">
    <mat-datepicker-toggle matIconSuffix [for]="monthPicker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
    <mat-datepicker #monthPicker startView="year" (monthSelected)="setMonth(\$event, monthPicker)"></mat-datepicker>
</mat-form-field>

<!--Here is the javascript. Move this code snippet to javascript block.
\$scope.setMonth=function(\$event, monthPicker){
    // TODO:Write your logic here
    $('#monthPicker').val(moment(\$event).format('YYYY-MM'))
    monthPicker.close()
}
-->
docHTML:
Angular material custom month picker
Follow the datepicker documentation. Move the javascript code to javascript block in widget editor

caption: mat:year-picker
snippet:
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" subscriptSizing="fixed">
    <!--subscriptSizing: 'fixed' | 'dynamic'; appearance: 'fill'|'outline' -->
    <mat-label>Select Year</mat-label>
    <input matInput [matDatepicker]="yearPicker" id="yearPicker" (click)="yearPicker.open()">
    <mat-datepicker-toggle matIconSuffix [for]="yearPicker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
    <mat-datepicker #yearPicker startView="multi-year" (yearSelected)="setYear(\$event, yearPicker)"></mat-datepicker>
</mat-form-field>

<!--Here is the javascript. Move this code snippet to javascript block.
\$scope.setYear=function(\$event, yearPicker){
    // TODO:Write your logic here
    $('#yearPicker').val(moment(\$event).format('YYYY'))
    yearPicker.close()
}
-->
docHTML:
Angular material custom year picker
Follow the datepicker documentation. Move the javascript code to javascript block in widget editor

caption: self
docHTML: Built-in variable self that is a reference to the widget instance

caption: self.onInit
docHTML:
The first function which is called when widget is ready for initialization.
Should be used to prepare widget DOM, process widget settings and initial subscription information.

caption: self.onDataUpdated
docHTML:
Called when the new data is available from the widget subscription.
Latest data can be accessed from the defaultSubscription property of widget context (ctx).

caption: self.onResize
docHTML: Called when widget container is resized. Latest width and height can be obtained from widget context (ctx).

caption: self.onEditModeChanged
docHTML: Called when dashboard editing mode is changed. Latest mode is handled by isEdit property of widget context (ctx).

caption: self.onMobileModeChanged
docHTML: Called when dashboard view width crosses mobile breakpoint. Latest state is handled by isMobile property of widget context (ctx).

caption: self.onDestroy
docHTML: Called when widget element is destroyed. Should be used to cleanup all resources if necessary.

caption: self.getSettingsForm
docHTML: Optional function returning widget settings form array as alternative to Settings form tab of settings section.

caption: self.getDataKeySettingsForm
docHTML: Optional function returning particular data key settings form array as alternative to Data key settings form tab of settings section.

caption: self.typeParameters
docHTML: Returns object describing widget datasource parameters.

caption: self.actionSources
docHTML: Returns map describing available widget action sources used to define user actions.

caption: self.ctx
docHTML:
A reference to widget context that has all necessary API
and data used by widget instance.

caption: self.ctx.$container
docHTML:
Container element of the widget.
Can be used to dynamically access or modify widget DOM using jQuery API.

caption: self.ctx.$scope
docHTML:
Reference to the current widget component.
Can be used to access/modify component properties when widget is built using Angular approach.

caption: self.ctx.width
docHTML: Current width of widget container in pixels.

caption: self.ctx.height
docHTML: Current height of widget container in pixels.

caption: self.ctx.isEdit
docHTML: Indicates whether the dashboard is in in the view or editing state.

caption: self.ctx.isMobile
docHTML: Indicates whether the dashboard view is less then 960px width (default mobile breakpoint).

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig
docHTML: Common widget configuration containing properties such as color (text color), backgroundColor (widget background color), etc.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.showTitleIcon
docHTML: Whether to show widget title icon.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.enableFullscreen
docHTML: Whether to enable fullscreen button on widget.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.useDashboardTimewindow
docHTML: Whether to use dashboard timewindow (applicable for timeseries widgets).

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.displayTimewindow
docHTML: Whether to display timewindow (applicable for timeseries widgets).

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.legendConfig.showMin
docHTML: Whether to display aggregated min values.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.legendConfig.showMax
docHTML: Whether to display aggregated max values.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.legendConfig.showAvg
docHTML: Whether to display aggregated average values.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.legendConfig.showTotal
docHTML: Whether to display aggregated total values.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.hideInterval
docHTML: Whether to hide interval selection in timewindow panel.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.hideAggregation
docHTML: Whether to hide aggregation selection in timewindow panel.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.hideAggInterval
docHTML: Whether to hide aggregation interval selection in timewindow panel.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.selectedTab
docHTML: Current selected timewindow type (0 - realtime, 1 - history).

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.history.historyType
docHTML: History timewindow type (0 - last interval, 1 - fixed)

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.history.fixedTimewindow.startTimeMs
docHTML: Timewindow start time in UTC milliseconds

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.history.fixedTimewindow.endTimeMs
docHTML: Timewindow end time in UTC milliseconds

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.timewindow.aggregation.limit
docHTML: Maximum allowed datapoints when aggregation is disabled (AggregationType == 'NONE')

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.units
docHTML: Optional property defining units text of values displayed by widget. Useful for simple widgets like cards or gauges.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.decimals
docHTML: Optional property defining how many positions should be used to display decimal part of the value number.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.settings
docHTML: Widget settings containing widget specific properties according to the defined settings form.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.alarmSource
docHTML: Configured alarm source for alarm widget type.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.alarmSearchStatus
docHTML: Configured default alarm search status for alarm widget type.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.alarmsPollingInterval
docHTML: Configured alarms polling interval for alarm widget type.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.alarmsMaxCountLoad
docHTML: Configured maximum alarms to load for alarm widget type.

caption: self.ctx.widgetConfig.alarmsFetchSize
docHTML: Configured alarms page size used to load alarms.

caption: self.ctx.settings
docHTML: Widget settings containing widget specific properties according to the defined settings form.

caption: self.ctx.timeWindow
docHTML: Current widget timewindow (applicable for timeseries widgets).

caption: self.ctx.units
docHTML: Optional property defining units text of values displayed by widget. Useful for simple widgets like cards or gauges.

caption: self.ctx.decimals
docHTML: Optional property defining how many positions should be used to display decimal part of the value number.

caption: self.ctx.currentUser.customerId
docHTML: Customer id of the user (available when user belongs to specific customer).

caption: self.ctx.currentUser.authority
docHTML: User authority. Possible values: SYS_ADMIN, TENANT_ADMIN, CUSTOMER_USER

caption: self.ctx.hideTitlePanel
docHTML: Manages visibility of widget title panel. Useful for widget with custom title panels or different states. updateWidgetParams() function must be called after this property change.

caption: self.ctx.widgetTitle
docHTML: If set, will override configured widget title text. updateWidgetParams() function must be called after this property change.

caption: self.ctx.detectChanges
docHTML: Trigger change detection for current widget. Must be invoked when widget HTML template bindings should be updated due to widget data changes.

caption: self.ctx.updateWidgetParams
docHTML: Updates widget with runtime set properties such as widgetTitle, hideTitlePanel, etc. Must be invoked in order these properties changes take effect.

caption: self.ctx.defaultSubscription
docHTML:
Default widget subscription object contains all subscription information,
including current data, according to the widget type.

caption: self.ctx.timewindowFunctions
docHTML: Object with timewindow functions used to manage widget data time frame. Can by used by Time-series or Alarm widgets.

caption: self.ctx.timewindowFunctions.onUpdateTimewindow
docHTML:
This function can be used to update current subscription time frame
to historical one identified by startTimeMs and endTimeMs arguments.

caption: self.ctx.timewindowFunctions.onResetTimewindow
docHTML:
Resets subscription time frame to default defined by widget timewindow component
or dashboard timewindow depending on widget settings.

caption: self.ctx.controlApi
docHTML: Object that provides API functions for RPC (Control) widgets.

caption: self.ctx.controlApi.sendOneWayCommand
docHTML: Sends one way (without response) RPC command to the device.

caption: self.ctx.controlApi.sendTwoWayCommand
docHTML: Sends two way (with response) RPC command to the device.

caption: self.ctx.actionsApi
docHTML: Set of API functions to work with user defined actions.

caption: self.ctx.actionsApi.getActionDescriptors
docHTML: Get list of action descriptors for provided actionSourceId.

caption: self.ctx.actionsApi.handleWidgetAction
docHTML: Handle action produced by particular action source.

caption: self.ctx.stateController
docHTML: Reference to Dashboard state controller, providing API to manage current dashboard state.

caption: self.ctx.stateController.pushAndOpenState
docHTML: Navigate to new dashboard state and adding intermediate states.

caption: self.ctx.stateController.getStateParamsByStateId
docHTML: Get state parameters for particular dashboard state identified by id.
